text: Musa has a choice of buying a shirt, a book and a bag. What is the opportunity cost of buying a book?
explanation:
The opportunity cost is simply explained as the foregone alternative. It is what you give up in order to buy something else.
In this case, Musa can either buy a shirt, a book, or a bag, but cannot buy all of them at the same time. If he decides to buy a book, the bag and shirt that he did not buy are the opportunity cost.

text: A typical feature of a market economy is that

options.D: there is equality of economic agents

explanation: A market economy is characterized by private ownership, freedom of choice, self-interest, buying and selling platforms, competition, and limited government intervention. There is consumer sovereignty in a market economy in a way that consumers decide what should be produced, while the forces of demand determine at what prices goods and services should be exchanged.

text: A cumulative frequency graph is
explanation: A cumulative frequency is known as an ogive. It is a type of frequency polygon that shows cumulative frequencies.

text: The privatization exercise in Nigeria is a move towards a
explanation: Privatization is geared towards a market economy in which economic decisions and the pricing of goods and services are determined by the supply and demand of goods and services. In this market economy, private individuals are major players and are actively involved in the production process.

text: A movement along the same demand curve is caused by the
explanation: A change in price leads to a movement along the demand curve and is referred to as a change in quantity demanded.

text: The demand curve for a luxury good is
explanation: The demand for a luxury good upward and positively sloping. Meaning the demand increases as the price increases.

text: A major assumption in cardinal utility theory is that
explanation: One of the assumptions of the cardinal utility approach is that money must measure the same amount of utility under all circumstances.

text: A supply curve is positively sloped because

options.C: price is an incentive to consumers
options.D: price is an incentive to producers

explanation: A supply curve is positively sloped because as the price of a commodity increase in the market, the amount supplied increases. Producers will be wiling to supply more of their products as prices increase.

text: The supply curve of a perfectly competitive firm is identical to its
explanation: In a perfectly competitive market, the supply curve of a firm is identical to its marginal cost (MC) curve above the average variable cost (AVC). Therefore, the correct answer is: marginal cost

text: In the long run, one of the characteristics of monopolistic competitive firms is that they
explanation:
In the long run, monopolistic firms can freely enter and exits the market, firms can make decisions independently; there is some degree of market power; and buyers and sellers have imperfect information.
The firms produce at a level where marginal cost and marginal revenue are equal. Companies in monopolistic competition will earn zero economic profit in the long run.

text: Double counting is a problem in computing national income when using the
explanation:
The value-added method calculates national income by adding value to a product at every stage of its production.
In measuring the National Income, the value of only final goods and services is to be included. However, the problem of double counting arises when value of intermediate goods is also included along with the value of final goods.

text: In the circular flow of income, an increase in savings causes

options.B: a decrease in the income stream

explanation: An increase in savings will lead to a reduction in the stream of income available for consumption in the household

text: According to the theory of comparative advantage specialization will result in
explanation:
The theory of comparative advantage simply explains what a country would do best while also giving up the least.
It is an economy's ability to produce a particular good or service at a lower opportunity cost than its trading partners. With this, the economy will enjoy resource allocation optimization and efficiency.

options.A: higher price at home than abroad
options.B: lower price at home than abroad

text: An important function of the World Bank is to
explanation: The world bank provide finance, advice, and research to developing nations to aid their economic advancement.

text: The major problem confronting a sole proprietor is
explanation: Availability of capital for expansion is one of the major issues faced by sole traders. These traders are left to either borrow capital from friends and family or from personal savings to fund their business, as financial institutions tend not to lend sole traders funds due to the unavailability of collateral materials and inability to repay loans.

text: A public liability company is run on a daily basis by
explanation: A public liability company is owned by two or more shareholders who own the shares of the company, and run by a board of directors appointed by the shareholders.

text: The marketing of agricultural products in Nigeria can be improved by

options.A: a massive production of farm produce

explanation: Re-establishing the marketing boards (Option B) can significantly improve the marketing of agricultural products in Nigeria. Marketing boards can help stabilize prices, provide farmers with better access to markets, and ensure fair trade practices.

text: To enhance the competitiveness of domestic agricultural products, there is need to

options.A: ban the importation of a agricultural products
options.B: increase the exportation of agricultural products
options.C: improve the quality of domestic agricultural products
options.D: increase the output of domestic agricultural products

explanation: Improving the quality of domestic agricultural products is one of the ways in which the products can compete in both the local and international markets. Consumers will always choose products that can give them the highest value and satisfaction for their monies, hence there is a need to have high-quality products.

text: In Nigeria, the location of a steel industry at Ajaokuta is due to

options.B: the proximity to source of power
options.C: the proximity to large deposits of iron ore

explanation: Ajaokuta steel industry is located in Ogun state because that is where the source of its raw materials is located. The raw material in this case is the iron ore

text: Industries for consumer goods are concentrated in urban centers as a result of
explanation: Clothing, food, and jewelry are all examples of consumer goods, and industries that are involved in this line of production are usually located at the place where the market for its products is large. They are high demand for these consumer goods in urban areas, that there is in rural areas.

text: Activities in the oil and gas industry are classified into

options.B: refining and marketing of finished products

explanation: Upstream oil and gas production is conducted by companies who identify, extract, or produce raw materials. Downstream oil and gas production companies are companies involved in the supply or sale of petroleum products to the end-users.

text: High dependency ratio is influenced by
explanation: The dependency ratio relates to the number of children (0-14. years old) and older persons (65 years or over) as against the working-age population. A high dependency ratio means people who depend on others for their means of livelihood. It increases as a result of high birth rate in a society.

text: Occupational distribution of population determines the

options.A: size of a population available and willing to work
options.D: size and categories of the labour force

explanation: Occupational distribution of labour refers to the distribution of working population among the different sectors in the economy. Occupational distribution of population is mainly the determinant of the size and categories of the labour force. The number of working people and their level of skills and expertise, is greatly dependent on the Occupational distribution of population

text: The mobility of labour is mainly determined by
explanation: The mobility of labour refers to how easily workers can move to different jobs within the economy. One of the major determinants of mobility of labour is the difference in wage rage. People will most likely be willing to move from one job to another when they are offered a job that pays higher than the current one.

text: When workers have a union, the supply of labour is said to be
explanation:
The word 'Monopolistic' relates to a person or business that has exclusive possession or control of the supply of or trade in a commodity or service. When workers have a union, the supply of labour is said to be monopolistic. By forming the union, the rights and interest of workers under the union are protected, and they would normally use it to influence and control the supply of labour.
If a trade union enters the labour market and becomes the monopoly supplier of labour supply it can force the market to pay a wage at, or nearer to, the market rate, and employ more workers.

text: The percentage contribution of the transport sector is:
explanation:
Percentage contribution of the transport sector = \(\frac{60}{360}\) x 100
16.66 approximately 16.7

text: If the contribution of the oil sector is N3.6 million, what is the contribution of the other sectors?
explanation:
Let the total contribution be x
3,600,000 = \(\frac{120}{360} \times\) X
3,600,000 = \(\frac{1}{3}\) x
x = 3 x 3,600,000 = 10,800,000
contribution of other sectors = 10,800,000 - 3,600,000 = 7,200,000

text: The marginal product of the 5th unit of capital is
explanation:
marginal product is calculated as the change in the total number of units produced divided by the change in a single variable input.
change in the total number of units = 425 - 212 = 213
Change in single variable unit = 5 - 4 =  1
The marginal product of the 5th unit of capital = \(\frac{213}{1}\) = 213

text: Determine the average product of the 4th unit of capital
explanation:
Average product is found by dividing total product by the quantity of the variable input.
The AP of the 4th unit of capital = \(\frac{212}{4}\) = 53
